etymologies: modern Latin, from French ailante, from Ambonese ailanto, literally ‘tree of heaven’ (the ending being influenced by names ending with -anthus, from Greek anthos ‘flower’)

definitions: a tall large-leaved deciduous tree that is widely grown as an ornamental or shade tree. Native to Asia and Australasia, it has been naturalized in North America and central and southern Europe.

notes.text: Genus Ailanthus, family Simaroubaceae: several species, in particular the tree of heaven

shortDefinitions: tall large-leaved deciduous tree grown as ornamental or shade tree
